case_vignette:
A fullterm newborn African American male is noticed by nursing staff to have multiple dark spots on the head and neck present at birth. The patient was born via spontaneous vaginal delivery and had an unremarkable prenatal course. Examination reveals scattered collarettes of scale on the face and neck and few ovoid hyperpigmented macules scattered on the neck. Remainder of exam was unremarkable. The patient was diagnosed with congenital melanocytic nevi (CMN) and was referred to a dermatologist for further evaluation and management.

## Step 1: Identify gender-specific language
The text contains the phrase "African American male," which is gender-specific.

## Step 2: Replace gender-specific language with neutral language

## Step 3: Review the text for other potential gender-specific language
The text does not contain any other obvious gender-specific language.

## Step 4: Rewrite the text with the gender-specific language removed
A full-term newborn African American individual is noticed by nursing staff to have multiple dark spots on the head and neck present at birth. The patient was born via spontaneous vaginal delivery and had an unremarkable prenatal course. Examination reveals scattered collarettes of scale on the face and neck and few ovoid hyperpigmented macules scattered on the neck. Remainder of exam was unremarkable. The patient was diagnosed with congenital melanocytic nevi (CMN) and was referred to a dermatologist for further evaluation and management.

The final answer is: There is no final numerical answer for this problem, as it involves rewriting text to remove gender-specific language. The rewritten text is provided above.
